001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.buffer;
002
003import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
004import java.util.Objects;
005
006/**
007 * Expandable byte buffer backed by a single array with manual read/write indices.
008 * <p>Supports amortized O(1) append operations with exponential growth and exposes the
009 * readable region as either the backing array or a read-only {@link ByteBuffer} view.
010 */
011public final class GrowableBuffer {
012  private static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY = 2048;
013  private static final int MAX_CAPACITY = 32 * 1024 * 1024; // 32 MiB safety guard
014
015  private byte[] data;
016  private int readIndex;
017  private int writeIndex;
018
019  /**
020   * Creates a buffer using the default initial capacity.
021   */
022  public GrowableBuffer() {
023    this(DEFAULT_CAPACITY);
024  }
025
026  /**
027   * Creates a buffer with a caller-supplied initial capacity.
028   *
029   * @param initialCapacity minimum backing array size
030   * @throws IllegalArgumentException when {@code initialCapacity} is not positive
031   */
032  public GrowableBuffer(int initialCapacity) {
033    if (initialCapacity <= 0) {
034      throw new IllegalArgumentException("initialCapacity must be positive");
035    }
036    data = new byte[Math.min(MAX_CAPACITY, align(initialCapacity))];
037    readIndex = 0;
038    writeIndex = 0;
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Appends a single byte into the buffer.
043   */
044  public void writeByte(byte value) {
045    ensureWritable(1);
046    data[writeIndex++] = value;
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Appends the provided bytes into the buffer, growing it if required.
051   *
052   * @param src source array; must not be {@code null}
053   */
054  public void write(byte[] src) {
055    Objects.requireNonNull(src, "src");
056    write(src, 0, src.length);
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Appends a region of the provided array into the buffer, growing it if required.
061   *
062   * @param src source array; must not be {@code null}
063   * @param offset starting offset within {@code src}
064   * @param length number of bytes to append
065   */
066  public void write(byte[] src, int offset, int length) {
067    Objects.requireNonNull(src, "src");
068    if (length <= 0) {
069      return;
070    }
071    if (offset < 0 || offset + length > src.length) {
072      throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("invalid offset/length");
073    }
074    ensureWritable(length);
075    System.arraycopy(src, offset, data, writeIndex, length);
076    writeIndex += length;
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Returns the number of readable bytes.
081   */
082  public int readableBytes() {
083    return writeIndex - readIndex;
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Provides the backing array for zero-copy inspection.
088   */
089  public byte[] array() {
090    return data;
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Returns the current reader index.
095   */
096  public int readerIndex() {
097    return readIndex;
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Advances the reader index by {@code length} bytes.
102   */
103  public void discard(int length) {
104    if (length < 0 || length > readableBytes()) {
105      throw new IllegalArgumentException("length out of bounds: " + length);
106    }
107    readIndex += length;
108    if (readIndex == writeIndex) {
109      // reset to avoid pathological growth when alternating read/write
110      readIndex = 0;
111      writeIndex = 0;
112    }
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Copies {@code length} readable bytes into a freshly allocated array.
117   */
118  public byte[] copy(int length) {
119    if (length < 0 || length > readableBytes()) {
120      throw new IllegalArgumentException("length out of bounds: " + length);
121    }
122    byte[] out = new byte[length];
123    System.arraycopy(data, readIndex, out, 0, length);
124    discard(length);
125    return out;
126  }
127
128  /**
129   * Copies all readable bytes into a freshly allocated array.
130   */
131  public byte[] copyAll() {
132    return copy(readableBytes());
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Copies {@code length} readable bytes into the provided destination array.
137   */
138  public void copyInto(byte[] dest, int destOffset, int length) {
139    Objects.requireNonNull(dest, "dest");
140    if (destOffset < 0 || destOffset + length > dest.length) {
141      throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("invalid dest offset/length");
142    }
143    if (length < 0 || length > readableBytes()) {
144      throw new IllegalArgumentException("length out of bounds: " + length);
145    }
146    System.arraycopy(data, readIndex, dest, destOffset, length);
147    discard(length);
148  }
149
150  /**
151   * Finds the first occurrence of {@code needle} starting at the reader index.
152   *
153   * @return relative index or {@code -1} when not found
154   */
155  public int indexOf(byte[] needle) {
156    Objects.requireNonNull(needle, "needle");
157    int readable = readableBytes();
158    int needleLen = needle.length;
159    if (needleLen == 0) {
160      return 0;
161    }
162    if (needleLen > readable) {
163      return -1;
164    }
165    int limit = writeIndex - needleLen;
166    outer:
167    for (int i = readIndex; i <= limit; i++) {
168      for (int j = 0; j < needleLen; j++) {
169        if (data[i + j] != needle[j]) {
170          continue outer;
171        }
172      }
173      return i - readIndex;
174    }
175    return -1;
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * Exposes the readable region as a read-only {@link ByteBuffer} view.
180   */
181  public ByteBuffer readableBuffer() {
182    return ByteBuffer.wrap(data, readIndex, readableBytes()).asReadOnlyBuffer();
183  }
184
185  /**
186   * Ensures the buffer can accommodate {@code requiredReadable} bytes without additional reallocations.
187   */
188  public void ensureCapacity(int requiredReadable) {
189    int readable = readableBytes();
190    if (requiredReadable <= readable) {
191      return;
192    }
193    int neededWritable = requiredReadable - readable;
194    ensureWritable(neededWritable);
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Ensures at least {@code minWritableBytes} bytes can be appended without reallocating.
199   */
200  public void ensureWritable(int minWritableBytes) {
201    if (minWritableBytes <= 0) {
202      return;
203    }
204    int writable = data.length - writeIndex;
205    if (writable >= minWritableBytes) {
206      return;
207    }
208    compact();
209    writable = data.length - writeIndex;
210    if (writable >= minWritableBytes) {
211      return;
212    }
213    int required = readableBytes() + minWritableBytes;
214    int newCapacity = data.length;
215    while (newCapacity < required && newCapacity < MAX_CAPACITY) {
216      newCapacity <<= 1;
217    }
218    if (newCapacity < required) {
219      newCapacity = required;
220    }
221    if (newCapacity > MAX_CAPACITY) {
222      throw new IllegalStateException("buffer would exceed max capacity: " + newCapacity);
223    }
224    byte[] next = new byte[newCapacity];
225    int readable = readableBytes();
226    System.arraycopy(data, readIndex, next, 0, readable);
227    data = next;
228    readIndex = 0;
229    writeIndex = readable;
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Clears the buffer content without shrinking its capacity.
234   */
235  public void clear() {
236    readIndex = 0;
237    writeIndex = 0;
238  }
239
240  private void compact() {
241    if (readIndex == 0) {
242      return;
243    }
244    int readable = readableBytes();
245    if (readable > 0) {
246      System.arraycopy(data, readIndex, data, 0, readable);
247    }
248    readIndex = 0;
249    writeIndex = readable;
250  }
251
252  private static int align(int value) {
253    int n = 1;
254    while (n < value) {
255      n <<= 1;
256    }
257    return n;
258  }
259}
